author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Department of Women’s Studies and the Department of Special Education and Rehabilitation Science, Alagappa University have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with M.S. Chellamuthu Trust and Research Foundation, Madurai for mutual co-operation in their common interests of reaching, research and extension and consultancy activities in mental health and related areas. The two institutions would organise training on mental health and counselling for faculty members of affiliated colleges of the university to promote mental health among the student fraternity of all affiliated colleges functioning under the varsity.

“The aim of the MoU is to understand the importance of mental health in learning, understand common mental health problems among students, roles and responsibilities of teachers in promoting mental health among students and to develop competence among the teaching fraternity in offering counselling to students with mental health problems,” an university release said on Thursday.

Under the programme, three faculty members from each of the affiliated colleges would be selected for the training. After training, the faculty would form a centre in their respective colleges to address the psychological issues and mental health of the students, it said.

The MoU also aimed at taking up collaborative projects at the State, national and international level funding agencies, the release said. The trust was working with the vision ‘Mental Health for all’ and mission ‘to promote mental health through holistic mental health care that is affordable and accessible to all.’
title: Alagappa University signs MoU
